text: The Most ReverendDespite his title he is not an Archbishop but by tradition the Premier Bishop of the Church of Ireland > Debrett’s Correct Form, Montague-Smith,P(Ed): London, Debrett’s,1992 William Hardy Holmes was a 20th- century Anglican Bishop.“A New History of Ireland” Moody,T.M;Martin,F.X;Byrne,F.J;Cosgrove,F:By Theodore William Moody, Francis X. Martin, Francis John Byrne, Art Cosgrove: Oxford, Oxford University Press, 1976 Born on 25 June 1873 and educated at Trinity College, Dublin, he was ordained in 1897,”The Clergy List” London, John Phillips, 1900 and began his career with a curacy at Christ Church, Derry. He then held incumbencies at Kilbarron and Ballyshannon.Ulster Directory 1910 In 1916 he became Archdeacon of Raphoe and in 1921 of Derry.“Who was Who”1897-1990 London, A & C Black, 1991 Raised to the episcopate in 1932 as Bishop of TuamCrockfords1932 he was translated to Meath in 1938.The Times, Saturday, Oct 15, 1938; pg. 14; Issue 48126; col B New Bishop Of Meath He died on 26 May 1951The Times, Monday, May 28, 1951; pg. 6; Issue 52012; col C Deaths ==Notes== Category:1873 births Category:1951 deaths Category:Alumni of Trinity College Dublin Category:Archdeacons of Raphoe Category:20th-century Anglican bishops Category:Bishops of Tuam, Killala, and Achonry Category:Anglican bishops of Meath
title: William Hardy Holmes
